description:
As a UI developer
  I want to create and manage groups of interactive buttons
  So that I can build consistent user interfaces efficiently

elements.name: Creating a basic horizontal button group

steps.name: I have a button group configuration system
I have an action factory for button behaviors
I have a clean localStorage state
I have a horizontal layout configuration with 2 buttons
I create a button group at center screen position
the button group should be visible and interactive
the buttons should be arranged horizontally with proper spacing
each button should be clickable and respond to mouse interactions

elements.name: User drags button group to new position

steps.name: I have a button group configuration system
I have an action factory for button behaviors
I have a clean localStorage state
I have a draggable button group at position (100, 100)
I click and hold on the button group
I move the mouse to position (200, 150)
I release the mouse button
the button group should move to the new position
the drag operation should update the group's internal position state
the new position should be saved automatically if persistence is enabled

elements.name: Button group drag interaction outside bounds

steps.name: I have a button group configuration system
I have an action factory for button behaviors
I have a clean localStorage state
I have a draggable button group
I click outside the button group boundaries
the drag operation should not initiate
the button group should remain in its original position
no drag state should be activated

the snapped position should be persisted

name: Universal Button Group System

description:
As a UI developer
  I want a central manager to orchestrate multiple button groups
  So that I can efficiently manage complex UI layouts with JSON configuration

steps.name: I have a button group manager system
I have clean localStorage state
I have a mock canvas environment
I have a JSON configuration with 3 button groups
I create a button group manager with the configuration
the manager should successfully initialize
all 3 button groups should be created and active
each button group should have its configured layout and buttons
the manager should track all active groups by ID

elements.name: Loading button groups from configuration file

steps.name: I have a button group manager system
I have clean localStorage state
I have a mock canvas environment
I have a JSON configuration file "ui-config.json" with multiple groups
I load the configuration file into the manager
the manager should parse the JSON successfully
create button groups for each configuration entry
handle any configuration validation errors gracefully
report successful and failed group creations
I have a button group manager system
I have clean localStorage state
I have a mock canvas environment
I have a manager with 4 active button groups
I request all active groups
I should receive all 4 group instances
each group should be properly initialized and functional
I request a specific group by ID "toolbar-main"
I should receive the correct button group instance

name: Button Group Manager - Universal Button System Controller

description:
As a game developer  
  I want entities to be automatically collected and rendered by the system
  So that I don't have to manually manage entity rendering

steps.name: I have an entity renderer
I have a mock entity system
I create a new entity with type "ant"
I assign a sprite with image "ant.png" at position (100, 150)
I set the render layer to "ANTS"
the entity should be discoverable by the renderer
the entity should render when the "ANTS" layer is processed
the sprite render method should be called
I have an entity renderer
I have a mock entity system
I create a new entity with type "resource"
I assign a sprite with image "leaf.png" at position (200, 250)
I set the render layer to "RESOURCES"
the entity should be discoverable by the renderer
the entity should render when the "RESOURCES" layer is processed
I have an entity renderer
I have a mock entity system
I create a new entity with type "ant"
I assign a sprite with image "ant.png" at position (100, 150)
I set the render layer to "ANTS"
I set the entity to inactive
the entity should not be discoverable by the renderer
the sprite render method should not be called
I have an entity renderer
I have a mock entity system
I create a new entity with type "ant"
I assign a sprite with image "ant.png" at position (-100, -100)
I set the render layer to "ANTS"
frustum culling is enabled
the entity should not be discoverable by the renderer
the sprite render method should not be called

name: Entity Lifecycle Management

description:
As a game developer
  I want the rendering system to show appropriate layers based on game state
  So that users see the right interface elements for each game mode

steps.name: I have a render layer manager
I have mocked all global dependencies
the render manager is initialized
I have layer renderers that track call order
the game is in "PLAYING" state
I request the rendering system to render
the "TERRAIN,ENTITIES,UI_GAME,UI_DEBUG" layers should be rendered
the "UI_MENU" layers should not be rendered
the "TERRAIN" layer should render before "ENTITIES"
the "ENTITIES" layer should render before "UI_GAME"
I have a render layer manager
I have mocked all global dependencies
the render manager is initialized
I have layer renderers that track call order
the game is in "MENU" state
I request the rendering system to render
the "TERRAIN,UI_MENU" layers should be rendered
the "ENTITIES,UI_GAME,UI_DEBUG" layers should not be rendered
I have a render layer manager
I have mocked all global dependencies
the render manager is initialized
I have layer renderers that track call order
the game is in "PAUSED" state
I request the rendering system to render
the "TERRAIN,ENTITIES,UI_GAME" layers should be rendered
the "UI_DEBUG,UI_MENU" layers should not be rendered
I have a render layer manager
I have mocked all global dependencies
the render manager is initialized
I have layer renderers that track call order
the game is in "DEBUG_MENU" state
I request the rendering system to render
the "TERRAIN,ENTITIES,UI_DEBUG,UI_MENU" layers should be rendered
the "UI_GAME" layers should not be rendered

name: Game State Rendering
